title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Rutland

ai_serp.title: rutland.gov.uk How to request permission for flat improvements council

ai_choice.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Rutland - Choice
ai_choice.match: Apply to make changes to your council flat
ai_choice.reason: David wants to make small changes to his flat and needs a simple online form to request permission from the housing team, which aligns with the need to apply for permission to make changes to his council flat.

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Rutland - Page
ai_page.body:
The page cannot be found

This is a new website - the page you're looking for might have been removed or had its name changed. To find the page you need, you can:

  • open our homepage and use the categories to navigate to the page you need
  • visit the new Rutland Information Service (RIS) pages
  • search for the page you were looking for using our site search page
  • use our A to Z
  • click on one of the ‘Suggested pages’
  • click the ‘Back’ button in your browser to try another link
  • make sure that the website address displayed in the address bar is correct

If you reached this page by clicking a link, please help us fix this - use the 'was this page useful' tool and tell us:

  • what link you clicked on
  • where it was
  • what page you were expecting to see

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Rutland - Feedback

feedback.Did the text answer your query?: No, the page was missing, so I couldn't find the information I needed about making flat improvements.
feedback.Was there anything that could have been: Yes, it would be clearer if there was a direct link or clear instructions on where to go instead of a broken page message.
feedback.Is there any way this text could be impr: Providing a functioning link or contact info for assistance would help me know what to do next.

ai_issue.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Rutland - Issue

ai_improvement.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Rutland - Improvement

text_issues.Issue: The page cannot be found and gives no direction for the user to find the needed information.
text_issues.original:
The page cannot be found
  This is a new website - the page you're looking for might have been removed or had its name changed. To find the page you need, you can:
  
    open our&nbsp;homepage&nbsp;and use the categories to navigate to the page you need
    visit the new Rutland Information Service (RIS) pages
    search for the page you were looking for using our site search page
    use our A to Z
    click on one of the ‘Suggested pages’
    click the ‘Back’&nbsp;button in your browser to try another link
    make sure that the website address displayed in the address bar is correct
  
  If you reached this page by clicking a link, please help us fix this - use the 'was this page useful' tool and tell us:
  
    what link you clicked on
    where it was
    what page you were expecting to see
text_issues.improvement: The page you are looking for can’t be found. Please use the links below to find the information you need or contact us for assistance.
text_issues.why: A clearer message with direct options helps users quickly understand how to get the information they seek, addressing the confusing broken page issue.

text_issues.Issue: Lack of direct links or clear guidance to relevant information about flat improvements.
text_issues.original:

text_issues.improvement: Visit the [Rutland Flat Improvement page](#) for detailed guidance on applying for flat modifications, or contact our housing team directly at [contact info].
text_issues.why: Providing a direct link or contact option makes it easier for users to find relevant information, especially after the original page was unavailable.

text_issues.Issue: No alternative contact information or method provided for users seeking guidance after encountering the error.

text_issues.improvement: If you need assistance, please contact us at [contact email/phone], or use our online chat for immediate support.
text_issues.why: Offering direct contact details or alternative support options helps users resolve issues quickly and reduces frustration caused by broken links.
